medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute-on-chronic aortic dissection with rupture leading to right hemothorax.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began with a rupture of the descending thoracic aortic aneurysm in 2014, resulting in right hemothorax and acute hemorrhagic shock. Prior to this, he had a history of an acute type A aortic dissection repair in 1999 and a 7.0-cm descending thoracic aortic aneurysm identified in 2012.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of acute type A aortic dissection repair in 1999, descending thoracic aortic aneurysm of 7.0 cm identified in 2012, and subsequent rupture in 2014 leading to urgent care.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a Jehovah's Witness and declined blood transfusions due to personal beliefs.
